title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 256.10 - Visual aids for the inspection of food containers
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 256.10 - Visual aids for the inspection of food containers

State Regulations

The following photographs illustrate major defects of
damaged containers which shall not be offered for sale or donated, and minor
defects of less damaged containers which may be offered for sale or donated. These photographs are demonstrative and illustrative only. Image

This is an example of a container in which the end seam has
been forced out of position to an extent that it is likely to affect the safety
and viability of the container (see section
256.8
[b][7]
of
this Part). Image

This is an example of a container in which the end seam has
been forced out of position to an extent that it is likely to affect the safety
and viability of the container (see section
256.8
[b][7]
of
this Part). Image

This is an example of a container in which the end seam has
been forced out of position to an extent that it is likely to affect the safety
and viability of the container (see section
256.8
[b][7]
of
this Part). Image

This is an example of a container in which the end seam has
been forced out of position to an extent that it is likely to affect the safety
and viability of the container (see section
256.8
[b][7]
of
this Part). Image

This is an example of a container in which a dent affects
the end seam, but has not forced it of position to the extent that it affects
the safety and viability of the container (see section
256.8
[b][7]
of
this Part). Image

This is an example of a container that exhibits moderate, acute crimping of the body wall (see section
256.8
[b][6]
of
this Part). Image

This is an example of a container that exhibits a moderate
dent which has created a slight end seam malposition (see section

[b][5]
of

This is an example of a container in which buckles extend

256.8
[b][7]
of
this Part). Image

This is an example of a container with a buckle that does

[b][7]
of

[b][7]
of

This is an example of a container with a cable cut (white

256.10

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
